snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump hinted strongly that he was considering picking James N. Mattis, a retired Marine Corps general, to be defense secretary....
abstract: Donald Trump has transformed businesslike process of appointing people to his presidential cabinet into made-for-television spectacle, showcasing his potential picks before media and adding element of drama via social media; most contenders are white men with hard line political and social views similar to Trump's own.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt reported from Bedminster, and Michael D. Shear from Washington. Nicholas Fandos and Mark Landler contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump hinted strongly that he was considering picking James N. Mattis, a retired Marine Corps general, to be defense secretary.

headline.main: Trump Turns Staid Process Into Spectacle as Aspirants Parade to His Door
headline.print_headline: Forming Cabinet, a Staid Process Turns Spectacle
